maml:description.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore
Adds one or more Sitecore users to the specified role.

maml:copyright.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

maml:description.maml:para:
The Add-RoleMember cmdlet gets a role and assigns users as members of the Sitecore role.
The Identity parameter specifies the Sitecore role to get. You can specify a role by its local name or fully qualified name.
Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

Specifies the Sitecore role by providing one of the following values.
Local Name Example: developer Fully Qualified Name Example: sitecore\developer
System.String Represents the identity of a role.
System.String Represents the identity of a role.
Disables the specified Sitecore user.

maml:copyright.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

maml:description.maml:para:
The Disable-User cmdlet gets a user and disables the account in Sitecore.
The Identity parameter specifies the Sitecore user to get. You can specify a user by its local name or fully qualified name. You can also specify user object variable, such as $<user>.
Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

Specifies the Sitecore user by providing one of the following values.
Local Name Example: michael Fully Qualified Name Example: sitecore\michael
Specifies the Sitecore user by providing an instance of a user.

System.String Represents the identity of a user.
Sitecore.Security.Accounts.User One or more user instances.

System.String Represents the identity of a user.
Sitecore.Security.Accounts.User One or more user instances.
Enables the specified Sitecore user.

maml:copyright.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

maml:description.maml:para:
The Enable-User cmdlet gets a user and enables the account in Sitecore.
The Identity parameter specifies the Sitecore user to get. You can specify a user by its local name or fully qualified name. You can also specify user object variable, such as $<user>.
Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

Specifies the Sitecore user by providing one of the following values.
Local Name Example: michael Fully Qualified Name Example: sitecore\michael
Specifies the Sitecore user by providing an instance of a user.

System.String Represents the identity of one or more users.
Sitecore.Security.Accounts.User One or more user instances.

System.String Represents the identity of one or more users.
Sitecore.Security.Accounts.User One or more user instances.

maml:copyright.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

maml:description.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore
Gets one or more Sitecore roles.

maml:copyright.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

maml:description.maml:para:
The Get-Role cmdlet gets a role or performs a search to retrieve multiple roles from Sitecore.
The Identity parameter specifies the Sitecore role to get. You can specify a role by its local name or fully qualified name. You can also specify role object variable, such as $<role>.
To search for and retrieve more than one role, use the Filter parameter.
Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

Specifies the Sitecore role by providing one of the following values.
Local Name Example: developer Fully Qualified Name Example: sitecore\developer

Specifies a simple pattern to match Sitecore roles.
Examples: The following examples show how to use the filter syntax.
To get all the roles, use the asterisk wildcard: Get-Role -Filter *
To get all the roles in a domain use the following command: Get-Role -Filter "sitecore\*"
System.String Represents the identity of a role.
System.String Represents the identity of a role.

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 1-----------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS master:\> Get-Role -Identity developer
Name Domain IsEveryone ---- ------ ---------- sitecore\developer sitecore False

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 2-----------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS master:\> "developer","author" | Get-Role
Name Domain IsEveryone ---- ------ ---------- sitecore\author sitecore False sitecore\developer sitecore False

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 3-----------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS master:\> Get-Role -Filter sitecore\d*
Name Domain IsEveryone ---- ------ ---------- sitecore\Designer sitecore False sitecore\Developer sitecore False

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the Sitecore users in the role.

maml:copyright.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

maml:description.maml:para:
The Get-RoleMember cmdlet gets a role and returns the members of the Sitecore role.
The Identity parameter specifies the Sitecore role to get. You can specify a role by its local name or fully qualified name.
Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

Specifies the Sitecore role by providing one of the following values.
Local Name Example: developer Fully Qualified Name Example: sitecore\developer
System.String Represents the identity of a role.
System.String Represents the identity of a role.

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 1-----------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS master:\> Get-RoleMember -Identity developer
Name Domain IsAdministrator IsAuthenticated ---- ------ --------------- --------------- sitecore\michael sitecore False False

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 2-----------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS master:\> Get-RoleMember -Identity author
Name Domain IsAdministrator IsAuthenticated ---- ------ --------------- --------------- sitecore\michael sitecore False False
Domain : sitecore IsEveryone : False IsGlobal : False AccountType : Role Description : Role DisplayName : sitecore\Developer LocalName : sitecore\Developer Name : sitecore\Developer

maml:description.maml:para: Gets one or more Sitecore users.

maml:copyright.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

maml:description.maml:para:
The Get-User cmdlet gets a user or performs a search to retrieve multiple users from Sitecore.
The Identity parameter specifies the Sitecore user to get. You can specify a user by its local name or fully qualified name. You can also specify user object variable, such as $<user>.
To search for and retrieve more than one user, use the Filter parameter.
Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

Specifies the Sitecore user by providing one of the following values.
Local Name Example: admin Fully Qualified Name Example: sitecore\admin

Specifies a simple pattern to match Sitecore users.
Examples: The following examples show how to use the filter syntax.
To get all the users, use the asterisk wildcard: Get-User -Filter *
To get all the users in a domain use the following command: Get-User -Filter "sitecore\*"
System.String Represents the identity of a user.
System.String Represents the identity of a user.

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 1-----------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS master:\> Get-User -Identity admin
Name Domain IsAdministrator IsAuthenticated ---- ------ --------------- --------------- sitecore\admin sitecore True False

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 2-----------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS master:\> "admin","michael" | Get-User
Name Domain IsAdministrator IsAuthenticated ---- ------ --------------- --------------- sitecore\Admin sitecore True False sitecore\michael sitecore False False

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 3-----------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS master:\> Get-User -Filter *
Name Domain IsAdministrator IsAuthenticated ---- ------ --------------- --------------- default\Anonymous default False False extranet\Anonymous extranet False False sitecore\Admin sitecore True False sitecore\michael sitecore False False

maml:copyright.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

maml:description.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore
Creates a new Sitecore user.

maml:copyright.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

maml:description.maml:para:
The New-User cmdlet creates a new user in Sitecore.
The Identity parameter specifies the Sitecore user to create. You can specify a user by its local name or fully qualified name.
Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

Specifies the Sitecore user by providing one of the following values.
Local Name Example: developer Fully Qualified Name Example: sitecore\developer
Specifies that the account should be enabled. When enabled, the Password parameter is required.
System.String Represents the identity of a role.
System.String Represents the identity of a role.

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 2-----------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS master:\> New-User -Identity michael -Enabled -Password b -Email michaellwest@gmail.com -FullName "Michael West"

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 3-----------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS master:\> New-User -Identity michael -PassThru
Name Domain IsAdministrator IsAuthenticated ---- ------ --------------- --------------- sitecore\michael2 sitecore False False

maml:copyright.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

maml:description.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore
Removes one or more Sitecore users from the specified role.

maml:copyright.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

maml:description.maml:para:
The Remove-RoleMember cmdlet gets a role and removes members of the Sitecore role.
The Identity parameter specifies the Sitecore role to get. You can specify a role by its local name or fully qualified name.
Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

Specifies the Sitecore role by providing one of the following values.
Local Name Example: developer Fully Qualified Name Example: sitecore\developer
System.String Represents the identity of a role.
System.String Represents the identity of a role.
Removes one or more Sitecore user sessions.

maml:copyright.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

maml:description.maml:para: The Remove-Session cmdlet removes user sessions in Sitecore.
Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore
Specifies the Sitecore SessionID.
Specifies the Sitecore user sessions.
Sitecore.Web.Authentication.DomainAccessGuard.Session Accepts a user session.
Sitecore.Web.Authentication.DomainAccessGuard.Session Accepts a user session.
Removes the Sitecore user.

maml:copyright.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

maml:description.maml:para:
The Remove-User cmdlet removes a user from Sitecore.
The Identity parameter specifies the Sitecore user to remove. You can specify a user by its local name or fully qualified name.
Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

Specifies the Sitecore user by providing one of the following values.
Local Name Example: admin Fully Qualified Name Example: sitecore\admin

System.String Represents the identity of a user.
Sitecore.Security.Accounts.User Represents the instance of a user.

System.String Represents the identity of a user.
Sitecore.Security.Accounts.User Represents the instance of a user.
Sets the Sitecore user password.

maml:copyright.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

maml:description.maml:para:
The Set-UserPassword cmdlet resets or changes a user password.
The Identity parameter specifies the Sitecore user to remove. You can specify a user by its local name or fully qualified name.
Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

Specifies the Sitecore user by providing one of the following values.
Local Name Example: admin Fully Qualified Name Example: sitecore\admin

System.String Represents the identity of a user.
Sitecore.Security.Accounts.User Represents the instance of a user.

System.String Represents the identity of a user.
Sitecore.Security.Accounts.User Represents the instance of a user.

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 1-----------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS master:\> Set-UserPassword -Identity michael -NewPassword pass123 -OldPassword b

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the Sitecore user properties.

maml:copyright.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

maml:description.maml:para:
The Set-User cmdlet sets a user profile properties in Sitecore.
The Identity parameter specifies the Sitecore user to set. You can specify a user by its local name or fully qualified name.
Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

Specifies the Sitecore user by providing one of the following values.
Local Name Example: admin
Fully Qualified Name Example: sitecore\admin
Specifies the Sitecore user email address. The value is validated for a properly formatted address.
Specifies the url to navigate to once the user is logged in. The values are validated with a pretermined set.
Specifies whether the Sitecore user should be enabled.
Specifies a hashtable of custom properties to assign to the Sitecore user profile.

System.String Represents the identity of a user.
Sitecore.Security.Accounts.User Represents the instance of a user.

System.String Represents the identity of a user.
Sitecore.Security.Accounts.User Represents the instance of a user.

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 4-----------------------
------------------EXAMPLE 5-----------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS master:\> Set-User -Identity michael -IsAdministrator -CustomProperties @{"HireDate"="03/17/2010"} PS master:\>$user = Get-User -Identity michael PS master:\>$user.Profile.GetCustomProperty("HireDate")
03/17/2010

maml:copyright.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

maml:description.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

Gets one or more Sitecore user sessions.

maml:copyright.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

maml:description.maml:para:
The Get-Session cmdlet gets user sessions in Sitecore.
The Identity parameter specifies the Sitecore user to get. You can specify a user by its local name or fully qualified name.
Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

Specifies the Sitecore user by providing one of the following values.
Local Name Example: admin Fully Qualified Name Example: sitecore\admin
Specifies the Sitecore SessionID.
None.
None.

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 1-----------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS master:\> Get-Session
Created LastRequest SessionID UserName ------- ----------- --------- -------- 7/3/2014 3:30:39 PM 7/3/2014 3:44:27 PM tekipna1lk0ccr2z1bdjsua2 sitecore\admin 7/3/2014 4:13:55 PM 7/3/2014 4:13:55 PM wq4bfivfm2tbgkgdccpyzczp sitecore\michael

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 2-----------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS master:\> Get-Session -Identity admin
Created LastRequest SessionID UserName ------- ----------- --------- -------- 7/3/2014 3:30:39 PM 7/3/2014 3:44:27 PM tekipna1lk0ccr2z1bdjsua2 sitecore\admin

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 3-----------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS master:\> Get-Session -InstanceId tekipna1lk0ccr2z1bdjsua2,wq4bfivfm2tbgkgdccpyzczp
Created LastRequest SessionID UserName ------- ----------- --------- -------- 7/3/2014 3:30:39 PM 7/3/2014 3:44:27 PM tekipna1lk0ccr2z1bdjsua2 sitecore\admin

maml:copyright.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

command:parameter.maml:name: Log
command:parameter.command:parameterValue: Debug | Info | Warning | Error | Fatal | None

maml:description.maml:para: Unlocks the specified Sitecore user.

maml:copyright.maml:para: Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

maml:description.maml:para:
The Unlock-User cmdlet gets a user and unlocks the account in Sitecore.
The Identity parameter specifies the Sitecore user to get. You can specify a user by its local name or fully qualified name. You can also specify user object variable, such as $<user>.
Copyright © Adam Najmanowicz 2011-2014 Cognifide PowerShell Console for Sitecore

Specifies the Sitecore user by providing one of the following values.
Local Name Example: michael Fully Qualified Name Example: sitecore\michael
Specifies the Sitecore user by providing an instance of a user.

System.String Represents the identity of a user.
Sitecore.Security.Accounts.User One or more user instances.

System.String Represents the identity of a user.
Sitecore.Security.Accounts.User One or more user instances.
